Posts.Content: ...All the things that have become semi - important to me over the last few years as I head into my last few before 40, then find out I have BC and have to have chemo and a mastectomy lol... Anywaaaaaaay. I have a few queries so will keep it short for anyone who can elaborate a little.. * Tell tale signs your hair is going to go even if youve had a cold cap? Hoe long should I wait? * I'm lucky to have a beautician BFF who can tattoo my browsfor brows for me. But she is panicking about threading them to shape 1st? Is threading ok? Will they grow again? * How likely is it my lashes will fall out? Is it practically a definate like my head hair? * Nails need a thick dark layer? Is shellac ok? I used to have acrylics in the past but wouldn't risk that now I don't think! So thats about it. Want to be one step ahead of this if I can? Much live and God bless Helena
Posts.Title: Hair, Nails, Eyebrows & Lashes

Posts.Content: That's awesome news. Mine reduced from4.5cm to 2.something after my first chemo! Looking forward to seeing is if disappears completely? Hope all goes fabulously with the op xxxxx
Posts.Title: feeling hopeful

Posts.Content: Hi Mel, thankyou for your message, its all interesting to know. I didnt think your head would hurt though. Strange. Are there changes to the rest of your body hair too anyone? Hoping to save time and hassle on waxing lol
Posts.Title: Hair loss :-(

Posts.Content: Emagermain, Where do you get your scarves from? I love the one in the photo X
Posts.Title: Hair loss :-(

Posts.Content: I had the bright letter box red before i went blonde, so normal brown feels a bit outragous. But I think I will go bright pink or maybe even purple when it all comes back!
Posts.Title: Hair loss :-(

Posts.Content: Hi Pepys, Mishtoon, JuJu and others xxx Well, 11 days since we last spoke and 15 since chemo No.1 I still have a full head of hair!!! So far so good. The last 2 washes have shown signs of lots of whisps dropping out. No clumps or anything and not a massive amount when i brush it through. I decided to dye it back to dark brown for my little girl, i figured if its going its gonna go so what the heck. Im going to wait until Thursday night next week before my 2nd FEC on friday 12th to decide if i go for the cold cap again or not. If no big clumps have come out by then, i will go for it again. I really do think that the Aloe Arborescens mixture i am taking is helping a lot too in the way of hair retention and my over all wellness. I feel awesome!x Thank you Lord... XX Noodles
Posts.Title: Hair loss :-(

Posts.Content: Hey Ladyb111rd! I am taking the aloe Arborescens! I did my research and bought it from - http://www.aloeone.co.uk/latest/juice-500ml It is 10ml a few mins before each of your 3 main meals every day. I have just ordered my 2nd bottle because I think it may well be to thank for the fact I feel awesome with the chemo. It also helps to maintain a healthy digestive system so perhaps will help with bloating etc for some? I suffered with indigestion and bloating and constipation for just about 4 days, that was all. As far as hair loss, mine is starting to shed quite a bit more than before, however, I am now on day 18 post FEC1, and anything could happen, but I still have stacks of hair and you can't notice any has gone at all. I will wait for the night before my FEC 2 on friday to decide if I will have cold cap or not. Xxx Ps. I had the horrible bruised feeling around a week ago and felt like I had been lashed with a whip across the forehead!hair is dropping a lot more than before but mainly sideburns and round edge a bit maybe because the cold cap didn't really get to those bits?? Down below fell out almost completely on Saturday, that was a funny experience and my eyebrows pluck able with hardly any effort, they just slide out lol!
Posts.Title: Hair loss :-(

Posts.Content: Going Going ....not gone yet though but gee wiizzz that's a lotta hair that I just combed out in the bathroom. So my scalp has been itching like a mummachuffa, I have had my hair piled on top of my head in a loose bunch all week. But when I took out my hair and tonight I found a mahusive matted dreadlock in the back of my head! So because I have Afro hair and not sleek straight hair, my hair has been detaching from the scalp with no where to go and just getting caught up in the curls and sitting still. I decided it needed a good comb out before washing it (which luckily I can avoid for days due to the type of hair I have) and stacks came out. I was emptying my hair brush every few strokes and once I finally got the dreadlock out, BOOM, it revealed a big bald bit the size of a chocolate digestive!! So it's a bit drafty round the back now and I have probably half the volume! But I am, for now, able to tie it back to hide it. I'm waiting for the hair loss to be undeniably noticeable and then I will invite my children to shave it off for me. Right, best place for a real hair wig please... Xxx
Posts.Title: Hair loss :-(

Posts.Content: Hi there. I had a few questions that have been answered in some way through this post so thanks very muchos! I had my 1st FEC on Thursday 21st after discovering a grade 3 invasive tumor surrounded by a large area of pre invasive... so im in for the chop after my 6 FEC-T and a reconstruction. So I literally have 'trademark' hair. I teach dance and fitness in a lot of schools and my nickname is based on my huge curly afro hair... not sure how they're going to feel about my bandana or beyonce wig lol? So I tried the cold cap on the advice that generally the thicker and curlier your hair is the better the cap seems to work. Buy how do you know your hair is going. Someone said a bruised feeling in the scalp. Mine has been itching a bit... what do you think?
Posts.Title: Hair loss :-(

Posts.Content: Thanks Juju. That's good to know.I think my itchiness is normal but will keep eye out for anything else.
Posts.Title: Hair loss :-(

Posts.Content: Hiya. Well there is definitely an accumulation of tiredness as you go. My 1st Doxetaxel was rotten. Consultant lowered the dosage, then lowered again for the 6th and final one. That definitely helped me a lot. I had my last chemo on 12th December! Im already feeling great and almost back to normal. Hang in there hunny, but always mention any thing that makes you feel less than 100%. Xxx
Posts.Title: 5th chemo

Posts.Content: That's not silly at all, at the beginning I had a cry over a failed pizza delivery. I compared the lack of control in that situation to my lack of control in being diagnosed with BC. NOW THATS SILLY!!!
Posts.Title: I had my first cry today

Posts.Content: Hi There, I have my first Chemotherapy appointment on Tuesday too. No pre-appointment for me though. I have a good idea of what to take too now, thanks for posting... Panicking too!
Posts.Title: treatment starts Tuesday

Posts.Content: Andreaemily, you are a genius. I'm pretty good with the makeup side of things, buti just watched your bids and they have helped a lot. Thank you. My eyebrows are like miniature patchy caveman brows at the mo, I'm having semi-permanent tattoo this week with my bestie beautician friend so hopefully no need to worry about that side of things. The contoured make up is a real help as I will be biting the bullet too soon after the cold cap simply extended the life of my gorgeous Afro noodles but unfortunately didn't save them! You look goooorgeous bald, thank you so much for your dedication and time in helping us all to feel better and more confident on the bald side of life. Xxxxx
Posts.Title: Makeup tutorials on you tube for us chemo girls

Posts.Content: Hello Steph.im sure you will find plenty of people here to help you feel welcome. I am a dance and fitness instructor aged 36 with 2 children 8 and 7. If I wrote a list of people I know I would still put myself at the bottom for Breast Cancer. I never saw it coming. Same as you I have had around 3 weeks to get to grips with finding a lump to finiding out that I will have 6x FEC-T and a Mastectomy eeeek! Try your best to just be positive, I think everyone around me is taking it harder than I am. If little one is none the wiser then you're doing a great job. X
